home.title: DinoGenics Solo Helper
home.play1: Play DinoGenics against a DiNO, the Solo Opponent.
home.play2: You can play against up to 3 DiNOs. The application replaces the card deck and guides you trough the rules.
home.play3: The expansion Controlled Chaos and New Arrivals are supported, and most of the modules.

modules.title: Modules and Expansions
modules.noControlledChaosWarning: It is recommended to play DiNO with the Controlled Chaos expansion.
modules.controlled-chaos-chaos-theory: Controlled Chaos Expansion: Chaos Theory Module
modules.controlled-chaos-dinosaur-elites: Controlled Chaos Expansion: Dinosaur Elites Module

setupBot.title: Setup DiNO
setupBot.prepareGame: Prepare the game as usual for {totalPlayerCount} players.
setupBot.botPlayerPieces: DiNO receives all player pieces of a color, the starting money, 4 fences and a Personal Island Board.
setupBot.botDNACards: DiNO receives 5 DNA cards, 1 Mutant reference card, and 3 Manipulation cards
setupBot.botDNACardsControlledChaos: DiNO receives 4 DNA cards, 1 eDNA card, 1 Mutant reference card, and 3 Manipulation cards.
setupBot.botDNACardArrangement: Place DiNO‚Äôs DNA cards face up and all Manipulation Cards face down on stacks next to DiNO‚Äôs Island Board as indicated.
setupBot.botTurnOrder: DiNO always starts last in turn order on the first round of the game.

roundOpenSeason.title: Open Season
roundOpenSeason.playerOrder: Determine player order based on reputation.

determinePlayerOrder.newItemsSelect: Please determine the new player order.

roundOpenSeason.assignVisitorCount: {visitorCount} visitors + up to {bonusVisitorTakeCount} of {bonusVisitorCount} bonus visitors
roundOpenSeason.receiveIncome: Each player receives 1 credit for each visitor in their park.
roundOpenSeason.breakingNews: Resolve the next Breaking News card, and draw a new upcoming one.
roundOpenSeason.drawFacilityTiles: Draw one random tile to each of the 2nd/3rd/4th facility stacks in the City Center.
roundOpenSeason.drawSpecialists: Draw two new specialists to the specialist display spaces.

turnBot.outOfLocations: Out of further locations, go back.

lackOfBuildingSpace.info: Lack of Building Space: In case there is no further room for the new facility, DiNO gains instead:

roundUpkeepPhase.title: Upkeep Phase
roundUpkeepPhase.feedCarnivores: Feed all carnivores (must feed carnivores as much as possible).
roundUpkeepPhase.spawnMutant: DiNO will create an additional mutant if it has already a mutant and has enough spare fences and additional goats for all carnivores and the rightmost (complete) preferred DNA set.
roundUpkeepPhase.checkRampage: Check for rampage, and roll if necessary.
roundUpkeepPhase.gainVisitorVPs: Gain 3 VPs for every two visitors leaving the park alive.
roundUpkeepPhase.gainDinosaurFacilityVPs: Gain Victory Points from dinosaurs and facilities.
roundUpkeepPhase.gainDinosaurFacilityResources: Gain resources from dinosaurs and facilities.
roundUpkeepPhase.returnWorkers: Return workers from the Mainland board to each owner‚Äôs park.
roundUpkeepPhase.advanceVisitorOverlay: Advance the Visitor Overlay one column to the left.

resources.title: Remaining Resources
resources.remainingStuff: Manipulation cards, goats and unused fences

scoring.title: Final Scoring
scoring.vpSpecialistsDescription: Specialist Endgame VP (most not awarded for ties)
scoring.vpDinosaurVarietyDescription: 3 VP for every unique species in valid habitat
scoring.vpDinosaurCreatedDescription: 2 VP for every dinosaur on the board
scoring.vpCreditsFinancialAdvisorPlayer: Financial Advisor: 1 VP for every 2 credits (round down)
scoring.vpCreditsFinancialAdvisorBot: Financial Advisor: 5 VP for the first 10 credits and 1 VP for each remaining 3 credits
scoring.vpDNACardsDescription: 1 VP for every 2 DNA cards (round down)
scoring.vpRemainingStuff: Manipulation cards, goats and unused fences
scoring.vpRemainingStuffDescription: 1 VP for every 3 remaining manipulation cards, goats and unused fences
scoring.determineWinner: The player with the most victory points is deemed the winner and acquires enough market shares to buy out their competitors! In the event of a tie, the player with the highest reputation of the tied players at the end of the game wins.

general.title: General Rules
general.intro: DiNO is treated as a human player unless otherwise mentioned and benefits from all cards and facilities as well as suffering penalties from rampage checks and Breaking News Events.
general.noMoney: DiNO receives all income but never spends Credits. All expenses are considered to be covered immediately. This includes buying facilities, performing Open Ocean Rolls, Aquatic Rampage Checks, DNA market purchases or Actions spaces costs.
general.noKilling: DiNO never voluntarily kills any of his dinosaurs. (Exception: specific Manipulation cards, Perucetus)
general.noHandLimit: DiNO has no hand limit and can collect more than 10 (e)DNA cards.
general.collectFences: DiNO collects fences to a personal reserve next to his board. DiNO uses fences when creating new dinosaurs or replacing broken fences. Dinosaurs of the same species are placed in the same habitat, if possible. In those cases, DiNO extends the fence-habitat by using as few fences as necessary to hold the new dinosaur. Broken fences are replaced immediately if DiNO has spare ones.
general.upkeepPhase: During the Upkeep Phase DiNO must feed carnivores and check for rampage conditions.
general.notEnoughGoats: If DiNO does not have enough goats to feed all carnivores, refer to the Rampage Choice and Assigning Damage section.

feedingPriority.title: Feeding Priority (feed in order of...)
feedingPriority.fedCompletely: Dinosaur that can be fed completely
feedingPriority.vp: Highest seasonal Victory Point value dinosaur

resolvingChoices.title: Resolving Choices
resolvingChoices.intro: When resolving choices DiNO Prefers to gain the most of each reward possible that does not give a benefit to an opponent. Choice preference:
resolvingChoices.gainScandal: Gain Scandal to avoid losing any of the above
resolvingChoices.rampageCheck: Resolve Rampage Check to avoid losing any of the above

affectedDino.intro: If DiNO has to perform Rampage Checks and can choose the affected Dinosaur, the checks are performed for the Dinosaur(s) with:

parkStructure.intro: When Park Structures are destroyed due to Rampages or other effects, the priority is:
parkStructure.lowestSeasonalVP: Fences of habitat with lowest seasonal Victory Point dinosaur
parkStructure.prioritize: Commercial and Park Facilities are prioritized in ascending costs.

priority.intro: DiNOs have a preference for interacting with players who are currently in the lead. If they resolve a Manipulation card or Chaos Theory Event that targets a specific person, they will choose the player who:

speciesSelection.title: Species Selection
speciesSelection.intro: Use this to get hints for DiNO‚Äôs choices of a dinosaur species. DiNO will always choose first option that applies. If none applies use the button again to get more hints.

facilitiesHabitats.title: Facilities & Habitats
facilitiesHabitats.intro: When DiNO takes actions to create new dinosaurs or place facilities it will do so based on the grid system displayed to the right and always start with the lowest position in a column.
facilitiesHabitats.newDinosaurs: New Dinosaurs are placed starting in the bottom right of DiNO‚Äôs player board. Habitats are immediately built as the new dinosaur is placed by placing the minimal number of fences required to satisfy the dinosaurs habitat requirement. If a dinosaur of an existing species is created, enlarge the existing habitat by exactly enough space to accommodate the new dinosaur. Habitats may expand into other columns of the grid once all space in the right most column is filled following the arrows listed in the diagram.
facilitiesHabitats.facilities: Park Facilities are built starting in the bottom middle column.
facilitiesHabitats.largeFacilities: Large Park Facilities (including Aquatic Habitats) are built starting in the lower left column. Large Park Facilities are placed so that only half of the facility takes up a park space.
facilitiesHabitats.commercialFacilities: Commercial Facilities are built in the column to the left of the visitor center and may expand into the right most column by first expanding up.
facilitiesHabitats.largeCommercialFacilities: Large Commercial Facilities are built in the column above the Visitor Center. Large Park Facilities are placed so that only half of the facility takes up a commercial space.

digSite.title: Dig Site
digSite.description: DiNO chooses DNA/eDNA based on the first incomplete preferred species stack.

geneGraftingLab.title: Gene Grafting Lab
geneGraftingLab.description: DiNO draws 1 additional (e)DNA without spending goats.

geneticsFacility.title: Genetics Facility
geneticsFacility.description: DiNO is allowed to use his spare stack to complete sets, but prefers to use complete sets and tokens/polymorphic cards first.

vipSuite.title: VIP Suite
vipSuite.description: DiNO builds on the side with the fewest Large Facilities. If tied, build in the Commercial Sector.

arrangement.title: Collection and Arrangement
arrangement.setCollection: During the game DiNO will focus on collecting DNA sets of up to 4 different species. As part of DiNO‚Äôs setup, create the preferred species‚Äô stacks beside DiNO‚Äôs Island Board. Unique species will form their own column while duplicates will be stacked as they are drawn.
arrangement.cardOrder: Start with the first two DNA cards/species (1st & 2nd species) on the right, proceed to the left with the eDNA card/species (3rd species) and a possible 4th species to the left. On the leftmost column, place the Mutant reference card. The Preferred Species 3 column is only specific to eDNA during setup.
arrangement.noDuplicates: If there were no duplicates the 5th card will be placed below the Mutant reference card to form a stack of spare DNA. Any Polymorphic DNA drawn during setup is added to DiNO‚Äôs reserve.

example.title: Example
example.description: DiNO received five random cards plus the Mutant reference card during setup. Because DiNO received two Ankylosaurus, they are grouped together. The DNA-species are placed in the order of reception from right to left. Place the Mutant reference card in the far left space. The Megalodon is placed on the 3rd spot from the right, because it was drawn from the eDNA deck.

acquiring.title: Acquiring New DNA
acquiring.intro: Whenever DiNO receives (e)DNA 1 of 4 outcomes will occur.
acquiring.matchExisting: The DNA card matches an existing preferred species.
acquiring.matchExistingResult: Result: Add the card to the existing preferred species stack.
acquiring.emptyColumn: The DNA card does not match an existing preferred species but 1 of the 4 columns is empty.
acquiring.emptyColumnResult: Result: Form a new preferred species by placing the card in the empty column.
acquiring.noEmptyColumn: The DNA card does not match an existing preferred species and there are no empty columns.
acquiring.noEmptyColumnResult: Result: Place the card on the bottom of the spare DNA stack.
acquiring.polymorphicDNA: The DNA card is Polymorphic DNA.
acquiring.polymorphicDNAResult: Result: Place the card in the DiNO Reserve; it may be used during a future action as part of any incomplete stack.
acquiring.noHandLimit: The hand limit of 10 (e)DNA cards does not apply to DiNO and it may keep any number of cards in any of its stacks of cards.

refresh.title: Refresh Preferred Species After Dinosaur Creation
refresh.intro: If DiNO created a dinosaur, check if the Spare Stack contains cards and use them to replenish an empty preferred species column. All cards of the Spare Stack are checked and chosen in favor of:
refresh.notInPark: Species that do not already exist in DiNO‚Äôs park.
refresh.fewestMissingDNA: Species with the fewest missing DNA cards.
refresh.hightestDNA: Species with the highest DNA requirement.
refresh.newStack: Pick all matching cards of the determined species and create the new stack.

breakingNews.title: Breaking News
breakingNews.7: DiNO discards 4 unused fences if possible; if not, damages an un-occupied facility worth the least end game points; if none, remove 4 fences from dinosaur habitats.
breakingNews.14: DiNO only uses this option if at least 2 cards in the Bonyard are prefered species.
breakingNews.27: Specialist that scores the most victory points.
breakingNews.29: Discard 1 DNA card to the Boneyard from spare if present.
breakingNews.30: DiNO resolves a normal City Center buy action.
breakingNews.33: DiNO receives VPs for all goats without spending money.
breakingNews.D1: DiNO decides not to roll an Upkeep Die.
breakingNews.D3: DiNO attempts the roll even if it does not have goats.
breakingNews.C01: DiNO removes a fence from a pen of the highest VP species. If tied: highest reputation.
breakingNews.C02: If DiNO has a scandal token and/or a damaged facility, or his opponents only have hotels, he discards a Scandal and repairs up to 1 facility. Otherwise he takes a scandal and destroys the building with the most end game VPs.
breakingNews.C03: DiNO bids after the card is revealed in an amount equal to the dinosaurs seasonal VP amount and doesn‚Äôt take a scandal.
breakingNews.C05: Get a number and count empty spaces starting from the upper left corner depending on the Advanced Selection Number. That‚Äôs where the token is placed.
breakingNews.N1: DiNO gains 1 Promotion Token if given the option.
breakingNews.N3: If tied, DiNO takes the VP.
breakingNews.N4: DiNO will take the first option if it could be used to create a dinosaur but not the second.
breakingNews.N9: DiNO gains 1 card from the Boneyard if a preferred species is present but spends nothing.

corruptedTRex.title: Corrupted T-Rex Variant Clarifications
corruptedTRex.intro: If the Corrupted T-Rex news card triggered, DiNO will adjust his actions:
corruptedTRex.dnaAction: DiNO will only use a DNA-acquiring action if he has no complete DNA-set at all (including the mutant card) and the action provides a chance to complete a set. if he is missing more than one card, he won‚Äôt use the refinement- or boneyard-actions.
corruptedTRex.market: DiNO will only buy from the market in the above case.
corruptedTRex.placeTRex: If DiNO has to place a corrupted T-Rex, place it in a 1x1 fenced pen if possible.

benefitsPackage.title: Benefits Package
benefitsPackage.description: Get a number multiple times to determine which Specialists are acquired. Stop once it has reached the cost of 3 or no more cards are available.

blackMarket.title: Black Market
blackMarket.description: DiNO buys all cards that would complete a preferred DNA set. If none fits, four new cards are drawn first.

controlTheNewsCycle.title: Control the News Cycle
controlTheNewsCycle.description: DiNO takes the Breaking news-cards and randomly redistributes them face down. DiNO receives 3 victory points.

dnaSplice.title: DNA Splice
dnaSplice.description: DiNO creates a dinosaur based on its first incomplete preferred set (right to left). Discard cards first from the preferred set, then from Spare and finally from stacks left to right until DiNO has discarded cards equal to the DNA requirement of the preferred set +1. This card is not played if DiNO lacks sufficient fences.

floodWaterCleanup.title: Flood Water Cleanup
floodWaterCleanup.description: DiNO places fences on 4 action locations. DiNO then gains 4 eDNA.

foreignMarket.title: Foreign Market
foreignMarket.description: DiNO discards the first Large Facility and the first Specialist then determines 3 Intelligen actions as normal.

geneticDeconstruction.title: Genetic Deconstruction
geneticDeconstruction.description: DiNO chooses option B if he has one spare DNA, otherwise option A.

goatRustling.title: Goat Rustling
goatRustling.description: DiNO only spends goats gained from other players for points. If no goats are gained, DiNO receives 1 goat from supply. DiNO spends as many goats as needed to move into first place.

infiltrator.title: Infiltrator
infiltrator.description: DiNO chooses the next two locations that already have a human player‚Äôs worker on them.

misdirection.title: Misdirection
misdirection.description: DiNO chooses the first location valid option ignoring blocked action spaces. If there are workers present in that location move them to DiNO‚Äôs next unoccupied action location (on the same card). DiNO then resolves the action of the first option chosen.

nonZeroSumGame.title: Non-Zero-Sum-Game
nonZeroSumGame.description: DiNO gives two cards from his Spare Stack, if there are at least three cards in it.

offshoreContractors.title: Offshore Contractors
offshoreContractors.description: Determine the stack by getting a number and DiNO builds the most expensive building in this stack. Redraw if a 5 or 6 is shown.

offSiteLocation.title: Off-site Location
offSiteLocation.description: DiNO moves 1 Large Facility and 1 Regular facility, each with the highest end game VP amount to this card. Get a number to determine free facility.

pullingTheStrings.title: Pulling the Strings
pullingTheStrings.description: DiNO gains a Scandal and chooses the first location that is closest to being filled but has an open space.

rapidGestation.title: Rapid Gestation
rapidGestation.description: DiNO chooses the species with the highest DNA requirement with the lowest seasonal victory point amount. DiNO then chooses a card from the Boneyard only if it will complete a preferred stack.

renovation.title: Renovation
renovation.description: Remove the most expensive unoccupied facility. If tied, choose the closest to the Visitor Center. Get a number to choose new facility.

researchPact.title: Research Pact
researchPact.description: DiNO keeps two cards, if possible from the preferred species. Give each human player one card in player order.

shareholderMeeting.title: Shareholder Meeting
shareholderMeeting.description: DiNO scores a maximum of 5 victory points for his current money. DiNO builds basic Hotels until he has at least 3 and gains 3 fences.

strongArmTheMarket.title: Strong Arm the Market
strongArmTheMarket.description: DiNO draws no new facilities then performs all three standard DiNO City Center steps. DiNO carries out step 2 once for each worker at the City Center. Determine facility again if #1 or no facility is displayed.

unleashContagion.title: Unleash Contagion
unleashContagion.description: Use the Species Selection to get a hint for an affected dinosaur. If possible, get hints until a dinosaur is selected who doesn‚Äôt have a reputation value of one of DiNO‚Äôs dinosaurs. Otherwise the first mentioned determines the value.

whistleBlower.title: Whistle Blower
whistleBlower.description: DiNO gives a card from the Spare Stack or incomplete preferred species stack, if possible. DiNO takes one preferred card if he can complete one of his DNA sets.

chaotician.title: Chaotician
chaotician.description: Repeat the Rampage rolls if no Na√Øve Visitor has been rolled. Repeat the Open Ocean Roll if both dice show a Drowning symbol.

financialAdvisor.title: Financial Advisor
financialAdvisor.description: DiNO scores a maximum of 5 victory points with this Specialist.

securityOfficer.title: Security Officer
securityOfficer.description: Only used to prevent DiNO deaths.

seismologist.title: Seismologist
seismologist.description: Exchange if a card in Spare Stack can be exchanged for a preferred species card.

technician.title: Technician:
technician.description: Repair the highest cost facility when acquired and at the start of each round.

allCost3.title: All 3 Cost Specialists (Pilot, Biogeneticist, Market Analyst)
allCost3.description: When acquired DiNO immediately gains victory points equal to 1VP per round remaining in the game, including the current round (1-7VP), plus VP equal to double its difficulty level (2-10VP). 3 Cost Specialists have no further effect.

trait.brontosaurus: Gentle Giant: Open spaces are a valid habitat. Rampages if placed in a pen, or if another species enters or occupies its open space.
trait.tyrannosaurus: Destructive: Roll two dice during a rampage check, and suffer both results consecutively.
trait.ankylosaurus: Defensive: Can share a habitat with any species without either rampaging.
trait.pterodactyl: Flight: Must be housed in a biodome to fulfill its habitat requirement.
trait.stegosaurus: Crowd Pleaser: During the upkeep phase, gain 1 credit.
trait.raptor: Clever: During a rampage check, in addition to normal damage, suffer one visitor fatality on a /// result.
trait.triceratops: Herd Animal: Gain an additional 1 VP in dinosaur value for every two triceratops in a shared pen.
trait.mutant: Monstrous: Existing mutants may each be fed üêêüêê once per upkeep phase to place an additional mutant into your park.
trait.gallimimus: Simple Genome: DNA requirement is 1 while you have at least one Gallimimus in your park.
trait.ichthyosaur: Swimming Partner: When placed, immediately gain 4 credits.
trait.therizinosaurus: Tree Harvester: Gain an additional 3 VP per season if the Therizinosaurus is in a habitat of 4+ spaces.
trait.plesiosaurus: Simple Feeder: Does not require feeding during the upkeep phase.
trait.megalodon: Leviathan: When placed, immediately gain 6 VP.
trait.mosasaur: Terror: During upkeep, you may destroy a dinosaur in your park to ignore feeding a mosasaur. If you do, immediately gain 5 VP.
trait.spinosaurus:
Aquatic Hunter: Destroy one dinosaur in your park when placed or resolve an upkeep die check.
DiNO always resolves the upkeep die.
trait.parasaurolophus: Pleasing Harmonics: During final scoring, gain an additional 1 VP for each species, including this one, that you have in your park.
trait.dimetrodon: Beach Dweller: When placed, immediately gain 2 VP for each directly adjacent (not diagonal) aquatic habitat tile.
trait.dreadnoughtus: Awe-Inspiring: Reputation is equal to the current season number. Requires at least two adjacent open spaces for a valid habitat and can never be penned.
trait.pachycephalosaurus: Destructive Entertainment: At start of upkeep, if its habitat borders another species‚Äô habitat (except open space) resolve a rampage check and gain 3VP.
trait.compsognathus:
Swarm: Discard 0/1/2 goats during the feeding phase to add 0/1/2 dinos onto the Swarm stack (6 max). A Swarm is a single dinosaur whose VP = dino tiles in the stack.
DiNO only feeds if it has enough Goats for all other carnivores in its park for the current season and next.
trait.carnotaurus: Swift Hunter: Gain 2 VP when you place an herbivore or omnivore into your park.
trait.dunkleosteus:
Teeth Grinding: During the feeding phase, you may destroy 1 of your fences to gain 2 VP; or 2 of your fences to gain 4 VP.
DiNO spends 1 or 2 spare fences if available and not required for the rightmost complete DNA set.
trait.depthDragon:
???
If DiNO has spare goats additionally to the next upkeep phase and the rightmost complete DNA set, he spends a goat and gains 1 refined DNA token.

difficultyLevel.1: Introductory: Good for players new to Worker Placement board games.
difficultyLevel.2: Easy: You are a casual enjoyer of Worker Placement games but prefer a lighter experience.
difficultyLevel.3: Normal: A good place to start for most gamers. A well-balanced experience.
difficultyLevel.4: Hard: You have a strong understanding of DinoGenics mechanics and want a challenge.
difficultyLevel.5: Very Hard: You have mastered DinoGenics and want to be pushed to the limit.

site-a.title: Site A
site-a.ruleSummary: Only if less than 2 complete DNA sets.

site-b.title: Site B
site-b.ruleSummary: Only if less than 2 complete DNA sets.
site-b.noMarketTokens: DiNO does not receive or use Market Tokens.
site-b.drawDNA: Draw 3 DNA cards; DiNO keeps the first that matches a right most preferred stack, or a card in its spare stack, or the first card drawn, in that order. Add the remaining 2 to the DNA Market.

boneyard.title: The Boneyard
boneyard.ruleSummary: If card for preferred species and less than 2 complete sets.
boneyard.locationUse: Used if DiNO can use at least one card for one of the 4 preferred species, that is not completed yet.
boneyard.severalMatches: If several exist, DiNO takes the card that matches of the rightmost stack.

agency.title: The Agency
agency.drawManipulation: Draw 2 Manipulation cards to DiNO‚Äôs reserve.
agency.discardScandalToken: DiNO discards a Scandal if it has any.

uplink.title: The Uplink
uplink.ruleSummary: If available and manipulation stack not empty.
uplink.locationUse: Used if DiNO‚Äôs Manipulation Card deck is not empty.
uplink.playManipulation: Draw the topmost card from DiNO‚Äôs Manipulation stack and follow the instructions.
uplink.playAlternative: DiNO will not play a manipulation card if the result would be an immediate rampage check. In those cases, put the manipulation card on the bottom of the stack and draw the next one. If DiNO has no additional manipulation cards, he instead gains 3 VP and ends his turn.

farm.title: The Farm
farm.ruleSummary: If no/not enough goats for this season and next.
farm.locationUse: DiNO uses the farm if it has zero goats or lacks enough goats to feed its built carnivores, and any carnivore in the right most prefered DNA stack, for the next 2 feeding phases.

time-share.title: Time Share
time-share.ruleSummary: Only if uneven number of visitors.
time-share.locationUse: Only used if DiNO has a Hotel with an empty space and an odd number of visitors.
time-share.promotionToken: If DiNO must take a Promotion Token from a player it always chooses the player with the highest reputation, if tied, the player ahead in turn order.

outsource.title: Outsource
outsource.useOtherLocation: DiNO carries out the action of this location without placing another worker:
outsource.actions: DiNO is not limited to taking actions with occupied existing workers and prefers the board space even if he has built a Private Airport.

city-center.title: The City Center
city-center.ruleSummary: Gain 3 fences {'|'} repair/hotel/gain facility {'|'} market buy/sell.
city-center.receiveFences: DiNO receives three new fences to its reserve and may replace damaged habitats.
city-center.facilityBuildRepair: DiNO repairs one facility if one is damaged (highest cost); otherwise DiNO builds a new facility based on the following criteria:
city-center.facilityBuildRepairBiodome: If DiNO has a preferred set of Pterodactyl DNA and a Biodome is available, DiNO builds the Biodome.
city-center.facilityBuildRepairHotel: DiNO builds a Basic Hotel if he has less than two Basic Hotels.
city-center.facilityBuildRepairOtherwise: Otherwise, DiNO chooses a new facility:
city-center.buyMarket: If DiNO can buy a DNA card from the market that matches one of its incomplete preferred species sets, DiNO buys it without paying. If there are several options, the rightmost card is preferred. Otherwise DiNO sells a DNA card, if the Spare Stack has at least two cards. In this case DiNO sells the card from the bottom of this stack and receives the sale price. If none applies, the Market is not used.

dinogenics-iom.title: DinoGenics IOM
dinogenics-iom.ruleSummary: If complete set, suitable habitat and goats.
dinogenics-iom.locationUse: DinoGenics is used in two cases:
dinogenics-iom.locationUseDNASet: DiNO has at least one complete preferred DNA set ‚Äì Polymorphic DNA cards and/or Refined DNA Tokens are considered.
dinogenics-iom.locationUseMutant: DiNO has not created a mutant yet and it has at least 2 DNA or eDNA cards that are not part of a complete preferred set.
dinogenics-iom.enoughFences: In either case, DiNO must also have enough fences to create a suitable habitat, and in the case of a carnivore, must have enough goats to feed it for the current season.
dinogenics-iom.creatingDinosaur: When creating a preferred dinosaur, empty a stack to the DNA discard pile and any remaining DNA is placed into the Spare pile. Choose right to left if there are multiple options. When creating a mutant, discard the Mutant reference card and 2 DNA cards. Prioritize DNA taken from the spare stack, then incomplete preferred stacks in order of preference left to right. DiNO will only create additional Mutants if gained from from a Bonus Card Benefit or from event/manipulation cards.
dinogenics-iom.createHabitat: Create a suitable habitat for the new dinosaur using the minimal number of fences required. Dinosaurs of the same species as existing dinosaurs (or Ankylosaurus) must be consolidated into a larger pen. An empty Bio dome is only used if a dinosaur with the Flight Trait was created or if DiNO is unable to create a viable habitat with fences.
dinogenics-iom.moveStacks: Finally, move all preferred stacks to the right to fill the empty space and refresh the empty stack space on the left with cards from the spare pile.

special-action.title: Special Action
special-action.locationUse: Special Actions are carried out if specific Breaking News cards are in play.
special-action.resolveAction: Resolve the action by placing DiNO‚Äôs worker on the specific card action space or the enhanced regular action space referenced by the card.
special-action.breakingNewsApply: Special Actions apply the following Breaking News Cards: 5, 8, 12, 14, 15, 16, 20, 28, D3.

site-d.title: Site D
site-d.ruleSummary: Only if less than 2 complete DNA sets.
site-d.drawEDNA: DiNO draws 3 eDNA without paying $1. DiNO keeps 2 cards that match a preferred stack, or a card in its spare stack, or the first card drawn, in that order. Add the remaining card to the DNA Market.

refinement.title: Refinement
refinement.ruleSummary: If less than 2 refined DNA tokens.
refinement.locationUse: Only used if DiNO has less than two Refined DNA tokens.
refinement.noMoney: DiNO does not have to spend a DNA card or money.
refinement.tokenPlacement: The token is kept near DiNO‚Äôs board until it is required to complete a set.

intelligen-designs-hq.title: IntelliGen Designs HQ
intelligen-designs-hq.ruleSummary: Open Ocean Roll or hire specialist, Large Facility.

openOceanRoll.title: Resolve an Open Ocean Roll (A1):
openOceanRoll.aquaticHabitat: DiNO immediately gains an Aquatic Habitat.
openOceanRoll.rollDice: DiNO rolls two Upkeep Dice to resolve placing a Plesiosaurus.
openOceanRoll.creditsVP: DiNO pays no Credits but will lose VP if the related symbol is rolled.

action1.hireSpecialist: DiNO gains Specialist A{number} from the from the display. No money or Manipulation cards are spent.

action2.aquaticHabitat: If DiNO has 1 or more Aquatic Species in its Preferred Stacks and no empty Aquatic Habitats, it builds an Aquatic Habitat.
action2.addLargeFacility: DiNO adds a large facility to it's park:

site-common.locationUse: Only used if DiNO has less than two complete DNA sets.
site-common.cardAssignment: Assign cards to preferred matching DNA sets or place them on the bottom of the Spare Stack.

bonusCardBenefit.gain-mutant: If DiNO has a Mutant and can provide a valid habitat for another, he gains another mutant.
